description: The Knapsack Problem is a classic optimization problem in operations research and computer science. The problem is to determine the most valuable combination of items to include in a knapsack, given a set of \param{TotalItems} with different values and weights represented by \param{ItemValues} and \param{ItemWeights} respectively, and a maximum weight capacity of the knapsack \param{MaxKnapsackWeight}. The goal is to maximize the total value of the items in the knapsack, represented by \param{ItemValues}, without exceeding its weight capacity \param{MaxKnapsackWeight}.

parameters.definition: The total number of available items
The maximum weight capacity of the knapsack
